intro: Souroubea fragilis, commonly known as the brittle souroubea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its fragility, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
